segments.text: Yes.  The real cause of that rile was Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, come on, you knew there was nothing in that.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I knew nothing of the sort.  You took presents from him.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Presents?  A trivial little broach.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Mmm Hmm.  I remember it well.  Bristling with diamonds in the worst possible taste.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not at all.  It was very pretty.  I still have it and I wear it often.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You went out of your way to torture me over Peter Burden.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No I didn't.  You made up the whole thing in your jealous imagination.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You must admit he was in love with you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just a little perhaps but nothing serious.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You let him kiss you. You said so.  What of it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well what of it?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well it didn't harm him, in fact, it pleasured him a lot and it didn't hurt me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: And what about me?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well, if you hadn't been so suspicious and nosey you would've never known anything.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, that's a nice point of view I must say.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Look, I'm bored with this conversation.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yeah, so am I.  Bored stiff.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You want some brandy?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No thanks.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'll have a little I think.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't know why you want it.  You've already had two glasses.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No particular reason.  Anyhow they were very small ones.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't see what you have to go on and on with this kind of thing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh my...just because I just...okay...
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: ...having three small minute liquor glasses in the evening is hardly going on and on and on.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's become a habit with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You needn't be so grand just because you don't happen to want any yourself at the moment.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't be so stupid.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Really Amanda.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Nothing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: [BREATHING]
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Going out somewhere dear?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, just making myself beautiful for you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: That reply has broken my heart.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: That's the woman's job to lure the man.  Watch me a moment won't you?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Actually that's perfectly true.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No it isn't.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes it is.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Oh, be quiet.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I think you should have some more brandy...
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I think that
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: ...cause really
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: it doesn't seem to be working on you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: perhaps maybe you should've had more brandy, it might've made you a little less disagreeable.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Well it really hasn't worked wonders with you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Hmm, snap, snap, snap like a little adder.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Adders don't snap, they sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Yes they do.  They have a bag of venom behind their fangs and they snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They sting.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: They snap.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I don't care.  I don't care.  Do you understand?  I don't care if they roll around and bark like hoops.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Did you see much of Peter Burden after our divorce?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Yes, I did.  Quite a lot.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I suppose you let him kiss you a great deal more then?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Mind your business.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Mmm, you must've had a riotous time.  No restraint at all, very enjoyable.  You never had much anyhow.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You're quite insufferable.  I expect it's because you're drunk.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: I'm not in the least bit drunk.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You've always had a weak head.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Okay, like I mentioned before I had three very small, minute liquor glasses of brandy.  That's not even enough to get a child of two drunk.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: On the contrary, a child of two can get violently drunk off just one glass of brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, what an interesting topic.  What about a child of four and a child of six?  A child of nine?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Shut up.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: We might be able to bring up a splendid little debate about this intemperate tots.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Not very funny dear.  In fact, maybe you better have some more brandy.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, thanks.  I think I will.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You better turn that off.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Why?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Because people upstairs will get annoyed.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: There aren't any people upstairs.  This is a photographer's studio.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well there are people downstairs I suppose.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: They are away in Tunis.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Oh, this is no time to be in here for Tunis.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Turn it on again, please.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: No I'll do no such thing.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Very well.  If you insist on being a boorish and idiotic.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Come on, turn it off.  It's driving me mad.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You are far too temperamental.  Try to control yourself.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Turn it--Turn it off.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Go away.  Go away.  I hate you.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Very amusing indeed.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I hate you.  Listen I'm sick and tired of listening to you, you sadistic bully.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You know what?  You're a vile, little, evil-minded, little, wicked beast and I never want to see you again.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: This is the end.  Understand?  This is the end, here and now, forever and always.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You're not going nowhere. No you're not.

segments.text: Oh, yes I am. Yes I am and you can't stop me.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Just shut up.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: shut up. shut up.  I would-I would never marry you again if you came crawling back to me on your hands and knees because you're an evil-minded little vampire and I hope to God I never see you again.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Listen, you're a cruel fiend and I hate, loathe you.  Thank God finally, finally thank God I've realized just how horrible you are--and marry you?  Marry you?  Never. I will never marry you.  I will die die in torment-
